title: A Causality-Informed Modeling Approach
text: package can downloaded CRAN Github
code: # CRAN installation install.packages("rmdl") # Or remote/developmental version remotes::install_github("shah-in-boots/rmdl")

title: A Causality-Informed Modeling Approach
text: package rmdl intended way handle causal- epidemiology-based modeling following principles: Role determination variables Generativity formula creation Multiple model management

title: A Causality-Informed Modeling Approach
text: package simple use. mtcars dataset serve example, use linear regressions primary test. toy example shows building six models parallel, key exposure wt term, two outcomes mpg hp.
code: library(rmdl) #> Loading required package: vctrs #> Loading required package: tibble #>  #> Attaching package: 'tibble' #> The following object is masked from 'package:vctrs': #>  #>     data_frame  f <- fmls(mpg + hp ~ .x(wt) + disp + cyl + am, pattern = "parallel") m <- fit(f, .fn = lm, data = mtcars, raw = FALSE) mt <- model_table(mileage = m) print(mt) #> <mdl_tbl> #>   id        formula_index data_id name  model_call formula_call outcome exposure #>   <chr>     <list>        <chr>   <chr> <chr>      <chr>        <chr>   <chr>    #> 1 b4845f79… <dbl [6]>     mtcars  mile… lm         mpg ~ wt + … mpg     wt       #> 2 7830bcbe… <dbl [6]>     mtcars  mile… lm         mpg ~ wt + … mpg     wt       #> 3 e3cf8431… <dbl [6]>     mtcars  mile… lm         mpg ~ wt + … mpg     wt       #> 4 9a66d0e5… <dbl [6]>     mtcars  mile… lm         hp ~ wt + d… hp      wt       #> 5 62f89920… <dbl [6]>     mtcars  mile… lm         hp ~ wt + c… hp      wt       #> 6 193d7c3e… <dbl [6]>     mtcars  mile… lm         hp ~ wt + am hp      wt       #> # ℹ 7 more variables: mediator <chr>, interaction <chr>, strata <lgl>, #> #   level <lgl>, model_parameters <list>, model_summary <list>, #> #   fit_status <lgl>

title: Estimating interaction effect estimates — estimate_interaction
text: using categorical interaction terms mdl_tbl object, estimates interaction terms confidence intervals can evaluated. effect interaction estimates based levels interaction term. estimates intervals can derived estimate_interaction() function. approach based method described Figueiras et al. (1998).

title: Estimating interaction effect estimates — estimate_interaction
text: object mdl_tbl object subset single row exposure exposure variable model interaction interaction variable model conf_level confidence level confidence interval ... Arguments passed methods

title: Estimating interaction effect estimates — estimate_interaction
text: data.frame n = levels(interaction) rows (presence absence interaction term) n = 5 columns: estimate: beta coefficient interaction effect based level conf_low: lower bound confidence interval estimate conf_high: higher bound confidence interval estimate p_value: p-value overall interaction effect across levels nobs: number observations within interaction level level: level interaction term

title: Estimating interaction effect estimates — estimate_interaction
text: estimate_interaction() requires mdl_tbl object single row length. Filtering mdl_tbl occur prior passing function. Additionally, function assumes interaction term binary. categorical, current recommendation use dummy variables corresponding levels prior modeling.

title: Estimating interaction effect estimates — estimate_interaction
text: . Figueiras, J. M. Domenech-Massons, Carmen Cadarso, 'Regression models: calculating confidence intervals effects presence interactions', Statistics Medicine, 17, 2099-2105 (1998)

title: Vectorized formulas — fmls
text: meant supersede stats::formula() object, provide series relationships can helpful causal modeling. fmls can converted traditional formula ease. base object built tm() object.

title: Vectorized formulas — fmls
text: expansion pattern allows instructions covariates included different formulas. , assuming x1, x2, x3 covariates... $$y = x1 + x2 + x3$$ Direct: $$y = x1 + x2 + x3$$ Seqential: $$y = x1$$ $$y = x1 + x2$$ $$y = x1 + x2 + x3$$ Parallel: $$y = x1$$ $$y = x2$$ $$y = x3$$

title: Vectorized formulas — fmls
text: Specific roles variable plays within formula. particular importance, serve special terms can effect formula interpreted. Formulas can condensed applying specific role individual runes function/wrapper. example, y ~ .x(x1) + x2 + x3. signify x1 specific role exposure. Grouped variables slightly different placed together hierarchy tier. indicate group tier, shortcut can integer following .g. number given, assumed tier. Ex: y ~ x1 + .g1(x2) + .g1(x3) Warning: single shortcut can applied variable within formula directly.

title: Vectorized formulas — fmls
text: single argument, e.g. tm.formula() method, identify variable X exposure, formula given term interest LHS, description instruction RHS. look like role = "exposure" ~ X. arguments dispatched objects plural, e.g. containing multiple terms, formula() placed within list(). example, role argument written: role = list(X ~ "exposure", M ~ "mediator", C ~ "confounder") implementation details can seen implementation labeled_formulas_to_named_list().

title: Model Prototypes — models
code: mdl(x = unspecified(), ...)  # S3 method for character mdl(   x,   formulas,   parameter_estimates = data.frame(),   summary_info = list(),   data_name,   strata_variable = NA_character_,   strata_level = NA_character_,   ... )  # S3 method for lm mdl(   x = unspecified(),   formulas = fmls(),   data_name = character(),   strata_variable = character(),   strata_level = character(),   ... )  # S3 method for glm mdl(   x = unspecified(),   formulas = fmls(),   data_name = character(),   strata_variable = character(),   strata_level = character(),   ... )  # S3 method for coxph mdl(   x = unspecified(),   formulas = fmls(),   data_name = character(),   strata_variable = character(),   strata_level = character(),   ... )  # S3 method for default mdl(x, ...)  model(x = unspecified(), ...)

title: Model Prototypes — models
text: x Model object representation ... Arguments passed methods formulas Formula(s) given either formula fmls object parameter_estimates data.frame contains columns representing terms individual estimates coefficients, can accompanied additional statistic columns. default, assumes term = term name estimate = estimate coefficient summary_info list contains columns representing summary statistic model. default, assumes... nobs = number observations degrees_freedom = degrees freedom statistic = test statistic p_value = p-value overall model var_cov = variance-covariance matrix predicted coefficients data_name String representing name dataset used strata_variable String term served stratifying variable strata_level Value level term specified strata_variable

title: Model Prototypes — models
text: object mdl class, essentially equal-length list parameters describe single model. retains original formula call related roles formula.

title: rmdl package — rmdl-package
text: system describing manipulating many models generated causal inference data analysis projects, based causal theory criteria Austin Bradford Hill (1965) doi:10.1177/003591576505800503 . system includes addition formal attributes modify base `R` objects, including terms formulas, focus variable roles "-calculus" modeling, described Pearl (2010) doi:10.2202/1557-4679.1203 . example, definition exposure, outcome, interaction implicit roles variables take formula. premises allow fluent modeling approach focusing variable relationships, assessing effect modification, described VanderWeele Robins (2007) doi:10.1097/EDE.0b013e318127181b . essential goal help contextualize formulas models causality-oriented workflows.

title: Create vectorized terms — tm
text: x object can coerced tm object. ... Arguments passed methods role Specific roles variable plays within formula. particular importance, serve special terms can effect formula interpreted. Please see Roles section details. options roles : outcome exposure predictor confounder mediator interaction strata group unknown side side formula term . Options c("left", "right", "meta", "unknown"). meta option refers term may apply globally terms. label Display-quality label describing variable group Grouping variable name modeling placing terms together. integer value given identify group term . hierarchy 1 n incrementally. type Type variable, either categorical (qualitative) continuous (quantitative) distribution variable specifically subcategorized, e.g. ordinal, continuous, dichotomous, etc description Option descriptions definitions needed tm, potentially part data dictionary transformation Modification term applied combining data

title: rmdl 0.1.0
text: CRAN release: 2024-05-02 first CRAN release contains basic functions package, introduces new basic classes. tm gives variables formulas specific roles behaviors (vectorized) fmls expands base formula class list related formulas (vectorized) mdl thin wrapper (vectorized) statistical models, important metadata maintained, used generate mdl_tbl objects, serve reference data.frame family modeling objects
